author: Staff Reporter
text:
Bankers have been instructed to monitor high-value transactions of their customers at a bankers’ meeting held at the Collectorate here on Wednesday.

Officials should inform the district election authorities about individual transactions exceeding Rs. 10 lakh, wire transfer through RTGS to many accounts from one account, party candidates or their spouses or relatives transacting above Rs. 1 lakh, politicians transacting above Rs. 1 lakh, and other suspected mode of banking transactions.

Such information should be submitted on a daily basis with details of the name of the account holder and account number. Returning Officers, AROs, DRDA Project Director, Personal Assistant to Collector (Accounts), District Treasury Officer, Lead District Bank Manager and branch managers of banks participated.

Marriage halls

Owners of marriage halls, printing presses and lodges were asked not to violate model code of conduct as it would lead to imprisonment and fine.

Addressing them at the Collectorate on Thursday, District Election Officer and Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan said that press owners should print the name of press and number of copies on pamphlets printed for election campaigns. Also, no pamphlets should carry message that would hurt religious sentiments or induce hatred among people.

The Collector said that only if the political parties obtained permission from the election officials for conducting meeting in marriage hall, the owners should permit them.

If the owners found distribution of gifts or money in the marriage hall by the parties, they should inform the election officials. Violations would invite up to six months of imprisonment and a fine of Rs. 2,000, he added.
title: Bankers told to monitor high-value transactions
